data

Class FeatureVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.FeatureVector

  • public class FeatureVector
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents text as a bag of words. Provides methods that allow clients to alter, access, and pretty-print the data.
    Author:
    Miles Efron

    • Constructor Detail

      • FeatureVector

        public FeatureVector()

    • Method Detail

      • addText

        public void addText(java.lang.String text)
        Allows us to pass in a (possibly long) text string for insertion into this vector. This method will clean up the text in various ways (case-folding, applying a stoplist, removing punctuation and extra whitespace, removing very short 'words').
        Parameters:
        text - A raw string of 0 or more words

      • addFeature

        public void addFeature(java.lang.String feature)
                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Adds a single feature (e.g. a word) to the vector. This is useful if a client needs to bypass the text cleaning in the addText method.
        Parameters:
        feature - A feature to add to the vector. No cleanup is done on this feature; it will be inserted exactly as-is. Additionally, inserting a feature via this method increases the feature's count in the vector.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • setFeatureValue

        public void setFeatureValue(java.lang.String feature,
                            java.lang.Double value)

      • normalize

        public void normalize()
        Coerces the frequency values in the vector to lie in [0,1] such that all stored values sum to 1...in other words, this method turns the vector into a language model (i.e. a multinomial over the indexing vocabulary).

      • getValue

        public double getValue(java.lang.String feature)
        Provides item-level access to the values stored in the vector.
        Parameters:
        feature - the name of a feature (e.g. a word) that we want to look up in the vector representation
        Returns:
        the current stored value for this feature

      • getFeatures

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getFeatures()

      • getFeatureCount

        public int getFeatureCount()

      • clip

        public void clip(int k)
        Truncates the vector so that it contains at most k entries. N.B. This method is relatively expensive. It involves sorting all of the vector's key-value pairs and copying the largest k of them into a brand-new data structure.
        Parameters:
        k - the maximum number of values to retain in this vector.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • l2norm

        public double l2norm()
        Calculates the L2 norm of this vector (i.e. the vector length).
        Returns:
        The length of vector expressed in L2 terms.

      • setStopper

        public void setStopper(Stopper stopper)

      • cosine

        public static double cosine(FeatureVector x,
                            FeatureVector y)
        Static method to take the cosine of the angle between two vectors, x and y. N.B. This operation is symmetrical, so FeatureVector.cosine(x,y) = FeatureVector.cosine(y,x).
        Parameters:
        x - an object of class FeatureVector
        y - an object of class FeatureVector
        Returns:
        the cosine of the angle between x and y
